memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.swap
memberdef.name: swap

detaileddescription.para: Swaps this population with the speficied one; the age and the individuals will be swapped by this operation.
Swap is fast in case of both populations share a common pool, or they don't have one assigned, as not required to move individuals between the pools.

parameterdescription.para: the other population with witch make the individuals swap

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.add
memberdef.name: add

detaileddescription.para: Adds an individual at the end of this population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.add
memberdef.name: add

detaileddescription.para: Adds multiple individuals at the end of this population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.add

detaileddescription.para: Adds the list of individuals at the end of this population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.add
memberdef.name: add

detaileddescription.para: Adds all the individuals contained by the specified population at this population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.resize
memberdef.name: resize

detaileddescription.para: Resizes the current population.
If the new size is bigger than the old size, new individuals will be added cloning random individuals, thus requiring that at least one individual is held.
If the new size is smaller than the old size, individuals will be removed from the bottom.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.resizeAs
memberdef.name: resizeAs

detaileddescription.para: Resizes the current population.
If the new size is bigger than the old size, new individuals will be added cloning the corresponding ones in the population argument
If the new size is smaller than the old size, individuals will be removed

parameterdescription.para: the Population to get the size from

memberdef.definition: final Individual<T> jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.remove
memberdef.name: remove

detaileddescription.para: Removes the specified individual from this population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.clear
memberdef.name: clear

detaileddescription.para: Removes all the individuals from this population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.trimToSize
memberdef.name: trimToSize

detaileddescription.para: Trims the capacity of this Population instance to be the list's current size. An application can use this operation to minimize the storage of a Population instance.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.reset
memberdef.name: reset

detaileddescription.para: Reset the individuals belonging to this population

parameterdescription.para: flag indicating if the new individuals are sorted

memberdef.definition: final Individual<T> jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.setIndividual
memberdef.argsstring: (final Individual< T > individual, final int index)
memberdef.name: setIndividual

detaileddescription.para: Replaces the individual at the specified position in this population with the specified one.
If the individual passed as argument already belongs to some population, operation is aborted returning null.

simplesect.para: the individual previously at the specified position, or null if the operation cannot have place.

memberdef.definition: final double [][] jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.getAllScores
memberdef.name: getAllScores

detaileddescription.para: Returns an array with all scores of all the individuals held by this population.

simplesect.para: an array with the scores of this population individuals.

memberdef.definition: final double [] jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.getScores
memberdef.name: getScores

detaileddescription.para: Returns an array with all scores for a specific objective of all the individuals held by this population. If individuals have a objective the index given as argument is ignored because individuals have one score.

simplesect.para: an array with the scores, for a specific objective, of this population individuals. If individuals have a objective the index given as argument is ignored and returns the score at position 0

memberdef.definition: final List<Individual<T> > jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.getAllLegalIndividuals
memberdef.name: getAllLegalIndividuals

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the list of legal individals held by the population. The list returned is recycled, thus the reference to previous legal individuals could become invalid.
the list of legal individuals.

memberdef.definition: final boolean jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.hasLegals
memberdef.name: hasLegals

detaileddescription.para:
Checks if the population has legal individuals
true if and only if exist at least one legal individual

simplesect.para: true if this population is empty; false otherwise.

memberdef.definition: final Individual<T> jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.replace
memberdef.argsstring: (final int index, final Individual< T > individual)
memberdef.name: replace

detaileddescription.para: Replaces the individual at the specified position with the specified individual.
Note:if a null Individual is passed as argument the individual at index position is removed

parameterdescription.para: the position of the individual to replace.

simplesect.para: the individual previously held at that position, null if the opration does not succeed.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.sort

detaileddescription.para: Sorts the individuals of this population in descending order, from highest to lowest score.

memberdef.definition: Individual<T> jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.newIndividual
memberdef.name: newIndividual

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new Individual. If this population has a pool, the new individual is taken from the pool. Otherwise a new individual is created.

memberdef.definition: void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.releaseIndividual

memberdef.definition: static Pool<?> jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.getDefaultPool
memberdef.name: getDefaultPool

detaileddescription.para: Returns the default pool

memberdef.definition: static void jenes.population.Population< T extends Chromosome >.setDefaultPool
memberdef.name: setDefaultPool

detaileddescription.para: Sets the default poll
The Population class represents a population of Individuals.
An important property of a population is its size, that is the number of individuals it contains. The Population#DEFAULT_SIZE constant is used as default if the size is not specified.

Population.Statistics collects statistics regarding the population. Statistics can be accessed by the Population#getStatistics() method and updated by the Population#updateStatistics(jenes.population.Population.Statistics).

parameterdescription.para: The class of chromosomes individuals are made of.
